comment_body: @jleveque somehow missed importing JSON in the previous #766 PR. adding here. Need your help to merge this fix.
@qiluo-msft: I opened a new issue to track this: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/issues/996
The check failures are unrelated to this PR. Since the PR is a bugfix, I am going to merge this in spite of the check failures.

Thanks @prsunny for adding reviewers to swss port-mirroring PR. 
Can u please help here also.

Thanks @prsunny

Hi @daall ,

Can u please help with review, I hope we can make this feature for 202006 release :)

Thanks
Thanks @daall  for the review. I have taken care of the comments. Can you please review again.

> Looking a lot better! Found a couple more things, there are also a few from last time that got missed. You might have to click the "Load more..." button in the PR to see all of them. :)

Yes. sorry. :) i figured once u started first comment, will push in some time now. Thanks for quickly checking.
Thanks @daall . I have resolved all comments. Can u please review.

@daall @kperumalbfn @dev-aviz , Just like the request in the [related PR](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1314), and given the imminent cutting of 202006 branch, can this PR be merged and any further updates to be made in 202006 branch?

Thanks!
@daall    found some other places where it can be fixed for simpler validation. Modified and pushed.  :) thanks
@abdosi , missed to add you to my request to review and approve.
@jleveque - can you check this PR , this was blocked for a while due to test failures -- the tests are all passing now

Hi, @samaity. I had tried to integrate this PR, and also PR's (links below) that you mentioned in the _"How I did it"_ section. 
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/765

And after that when I try to run the command:

`root@r-leopard-01:/# config interface -?`

I have the output like that:

`Traceback (most recent call last):`
`  File "/usr/bin/config", line 8, in <module>`
`    from config.main import config`
`  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/config/main.py", line 19, in <module>`
`    from config_mgmt import configMgmt`
`  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/config/config_mgmt.py", line 26, in <module>`
`    raise ImportError("%s - required module not found" % str(e))`
`ImportError: No module named sonic_yang - required module not found`

**So, should I integrate something else?**

Hi, @praveen-li, I had tried to integrate [PR 3861](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3861). After that I have a compilations errors that are related to sonic-yang, the issue appears when building sonic-mgmt-framework (compilation output below).

**So, should I integrate something else?**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62022266/81332423-be9d2b00-90ab-11ea-9cf2-f9fb1880dfd3.png)

> Hi, @praveen-li, I had tried to integrate [PR 3861](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3861). After that I have a compilations errors that are related to sonic-yang, the issue appears when building sonic-mgmt-framework (compilation output below).
> 
> **So, should I integrate something else?**
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62022266/81332423-be9d2b00-90ab-11ea-9cf2-f9fb1880dfd3.png)

Not sure about the errors in sonic-mgmt-framework, Because sonic-yang-mgmt and sonic-mgmt-framework, should not be related.  BTW, hope you are able to build sonic-yang-mgmt PKG,

Hi, @samaity @praveen-li. I had integrated [buildimage-PR3909](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909),  [utilities-PR765](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/765),  [utilities-PR766](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/766),  [buildimage-PR3861](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3861). Then in sonic-buildimage/rules/config, I disabled sonic-mgmt-framework to avoid compilation errors (that I described in above comment). And after all those steps, I still have errors when I run next command on the switch:

`root@r-leopard-01:/# config interface -?`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62022266/81659711-a2e6ab80-9442-11ea-927b-eafbb264f34c.png)

**Have someone of you faced such an issue, and should I integrate something else?**

> Hi, @samaity @praveen-li. I had integrated [buildimage-PR3909](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909), [utilities-PR765](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/765), [utilities-PR766](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/766), [buildimage-PR3861](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3861). Then in sonic-buildimage/rules/config, I disabled sonic-mgmt-framework to avoid compilation errors (that I described in above comment). And after all those steps, I still have errors when I run next command on the switch:
> 
> `root@r-leopard-01:/# config interface -?`
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62022266/81659711-a2e6ab80-9442-11ea-927b-eafbb264f34c.png)
> 
> **Have someone of you faced such an issue, and should I integrate something else?**

Kindly check if you have sonic_yang_mgmt PKG installed in pip. So "pip list | grep yang" must show sonic_yang_mgmt. Also "pip3 list | grep yang" must show sonic_yang_models.

Hi, @samaity. Could you please tell me, approximately when do you plan to integrate [sonic-buildimage-PR3909](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909)? Because there are merge conflicts that are hard to resolve properly if you are not a feature owner.

> Hi, @samaity. Could you please tell me, approximately when do you plan to integrate [sonic-buildimage-PR3909](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909)? Because there are merge conflicts that are hard to resolve properly if you are not a feature owner.

We are working on the conflicts, should resolve it next week, will review the PR with MSFT next week too.
conflicts have been removed from [sonic-buildimage #3909 PR](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909) and PR has been approved. Thanks!

Hi, @samaity @praveen-li. I had integrated [buildimage-PR3909](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3909),  [utilities-PR765](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/765),  [utilities-PR766](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/766),  [buildimage-PR3861](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/3861), without any merge conflicts on the latest master branch. Then I successfully build an image, but when I burn this image to the switch I have an empty CONFIG_DB and can't deploy a topology.

Do you have any suggestions?

> utilities-PR766

@vadymhlushko-mlnx
Till now we have not plugged config load\reload with config validation, so ideally empty config DB should not be because of PR 766, 765. @samaity can double-check, if platform.json can cause any issues.

But you should be able to load the config, what is the issue you are seeing while loading the config?

> Please document newly added command in doc/Command-Reference.md

Added as requested. Thanks, Joe! 👍

@praveen-li: We copy artifacts from the last successful build of buildimage-vs-all. I haven't done a lot of work with the new Jenkins infrastructure. @daall  or @lguohan can comment further.

> Just two concerns only.
> 
>     1. What if we abort after port delete, before add, which has higher probability as we wait for asynchronous sync of delete up to ASIC-DB -- For this we have filed an active issue.
> 
>     2. The time point  of collection of diffs for delete & add and the application of the same, are not atomic. Just concerned, any in-the-middle change , that could affect
>        At the  least, can we get a advisory lock, to the least that no two port-break commands can run  concurrently. May be not for this PR. But to give some attention,

@renukamanavalan 
+1 for Point 1.

-- for 2., we have config lock, but from Azure branch it is removed, so we will come up with approach which caters all.
Check build failure appears to be unrelated to this PR. Merging in spite of it.
